name: Citrine Sleet Campaign
description: ATT&CK Layer for the tactics and techniques used by Citrine Sleet in their campaign exploiting Chromium zero-day vulnerability

techniques.comment: CVE-2024-7971 identified as a zero-day vulnerability in Chromium that was exploited by North Korean threat actor, Citrine Sleet for remote code execution (RCE).
The vulnerability exploits a type confusion in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine in Chromium.
The FudModule rootkit was downloaded after the RCE exploit was successful. This malware allowed for the threat actor to gain control over the compromised systems.
The FudModule rootkit was loaded into memory and performed Direct Kernel Object Manipulation (DKOM).
The FudModule rootkit ran in memory, disrupted kernel security mechanisms, and performed kernel tampering through a kernel read/write primitive.
The threat actor used social engineering tactics to direct targets to a controlled domain where the zero-day RCE exploit was served.
The trojan malware, AppleJeus, developed by Citrine Sleet, was commonly used to infect targets and collect information necessary to control the target's cryptocurrency assets.
The FudModule rootkit targeted the kernel access, evading detection by performing Direct Kernel Object Manipulation (DKOM Techniques).
JPEG and PDF images were loaded with code to exploit the MagentoCore skimmer.
The threat actors targeted and collected private keys.
Attackers on a mission to find any weak Magento admin panel passwords.
